Employee: Current  Host  in Fairfax, Virginia
Description: [' They offer tones a stuff this place when it comes to being full time seems to have a lot of opportunities but I never personally dealt with any of their benefits']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Charlotte, North Carolina
Description: [' No vacation pay and 401k takes years to get access to.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Chandler, Arizona
Description: [' No benefits for part-time employees. Must work 30 hours every week for 52 weeks to gain benefits eligible status and must continue to work 30 hours every week to maintain benefits. Will revoke benefits if you do not meet hours.']

Employee: Former  Manager  in San Mateo, California
Description: [' They pretty much had no benefits but PTO. Health vision and dental were awful and paid mostly by employee']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Manchester, New Hampshire
Description: [' There is no benefit package that I have came across, but I have only worked here a few years. Not sure what they offer in the future or what management gets, curious though']

Employee: Former  Hostesses   in Greensboro, North Carolina
Description: [' There really wasn’t much of a benefits package. This was a ypical restaurant job. Not much time off and definitely not paid.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Ann Arbor, Michigan
Description: [" Employees donate $1 out of every check to help other RR employees in need. I hope never to need the program, but it's great to be a team."]

Employee: Current  Server  in Seattle, Washington State
Description: [' The benefits for servers and bartenders is practically impossible to attain. Requirements are 30 hours per week... sustained for 6 months. Anyone who has served knows that my hours is very hard to sustain without having a physical and/or emotional break down lol']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Bloomington, Minnesota
Description: [' I love working at red robin. I just want to know more about the benefits.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Maumee, Ohio
Description: [' If a discounted burger is incentive enough, but not much else in terms of benefits, then this is the place for you.']

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Sterling, Virginia
Description: [' Benefits were great. Paid maternity leave, options on insurance, free food']

Employee: Current  Server  in Apple Valley, California
Description: [' Benefits package would be great if more individuals could become eligible for it.']

Employee: Former  AGM  in Orange, California
Description: [' Health coverage options seem to be below the industries average.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Garden Grove, California
Description: [" Not good benefits unless you're full time and as a server you won't be full time. Only good thing is there are a lot of servers so you might get the holiday you want off if requested way ahead of time."]

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Idaho Falls, Idaho
Description: [' The only benefits are free food for Heart of House employees (Cooks, dishwashers, expos, and managers), sick days off for food born illness, and a day or two of training.']

Employee: Current  Assistant General Manager  in Gainesville, Virginia
Description: [' I took vacation paid after 3 months of getting hired. I ended with negative vacation hours that turned positive after few months. Happy with that.']

Employee: Current  Hr  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [' No 401k offered for most home offic employees']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Salt Lake City, Utah
Description: [' There were no benefits offered']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [" The only positive on their benefits were that we actually had them. The company didn't care about the employees all they cared about was how much money they were saving on their premiums."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Des Moines, Iowa
Description: [' Being able to rearrange your scheduled to that can have the time off that you need/want is great.']

Employee: Current  Regional Operations Manager  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [' For the casual dining / restaurant industry - Red Robin provides a phenomenal benefits package (Medical - with a reasonable deductible/co-pay - dental - vision - Vacation - 401(k) match).']

Employee: Former  DMO (Dish Machine Operator)  in Broomfield, Colorado
Description: [' The restaurant I worked at was always so great when it came to vacation and time off. I never had an issue with getting it at all.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Washington, District of Columbia
Description: [" The benefit package was not so great alot of the benefits we're not able to manager and the ones that were are not that good"]

Employee: Current  Server/Waitress  in Fairfax, Virginia
Description: [" You don't qualify for benefits unless you work full time for the company, and even then, the benefits are not worth the price. I had to purchase my own insurance outside the company. There are no raises after you have worked there for a certain amount of time, unless you are a manager."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Sherwood, Oregon
Description: [" As a part time employee I don't get any benefits. Only Managers are entitled to benefits like 401k."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Factoria, Washington State
Description: [' There was no benefits package that I remember being offered other than the healthcare option for full-time employees.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Hillsboro, Oregon
Description: [" It's ok But gets expensive if you upgrade to better benifits"]

Employee: Former  Assistant manager   in Staten Island, New York State
Description: [' 401k matching is actually not that bad at all. The health insurance was good, but nothing to write home to mom about']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Richmond, Virginia
Description: [' They took away the stock option and made the bonus teir impossible to obtain if you were a low volume store']

Employee: Former  Server  in Apple Valley, Minnesota
Description: [' If you were part time there was none']

Employee: Former  Server/Waitress  in Northridge, California
Description: [' If you are full time, you can accrue paid time off. They offer insurance to full time employees as well.']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Detroit, Michigan
Description: [' As an hourly employee, no benefits other than flexible schedule and easy time off.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Saint Petersburg, Florida
Description: [" I honestly didn't know they were offered but I am constantly denied for Medicaid no clue why but I need to see a doctor, when I started I couldn't work full time I can now"]

Employee: Former  Host  in Louisville, Kentucky
Description: [' Flexible hours for a positive']

Employee: Current  Assistant Manager  in Austin, Texas
Description: [' The coverage you receive as a full time employee is amazing! You are really taken care of in all aspects of insurance! I love it! The worst part is that it can be a little pricey but personally I think it is definitely worth it!']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [' They offer a generous PTO time..']

Employee: Former  Bartender  in Redmond, Washington State
Description: [" Health insurance is nice but wasn't cheap or available to new team members. They offer 401k, cool. They offer stock, great. Their bonuses are crap unless you're in a brand new restaurant."]

Employee: Former  Server/Waitress  in Saratoga Springs, New York State
Description: [" No benefits for part time workers and if you're a server you will most likely only be part time and don't receive the benefits a grill worker would get"]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' The only people that can really receive any "good" benefits are members of the management team. You do get a 50% discount on food when you work and 25% off when you bring your family in to eat.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Virginia Beach, Virginia
Description: [' I honestly can not speak on benefits from this company I was not offered any because of being part time.']

Employee: Former  Expo  in Bend, Oregon
Description: [' I was able to get $200 for my keys when they were lost through the Heart Fund. What a great idea, and helpful to many employees if they have an emergency.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Phoenix, Arizona
Description: [' It is extremely hard to get Health coverage if you are hourly Front of the House employee.']

Employee: Former  Regional Vice President   in Denver, Colorado
Description: [' It was one of the better in the industry. The year end bonus and stock options were paid out on time']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [" 401k matching and tuition reimbursement don't kick in until you've been here for a year"]

Employee: Current  Server/Waiter  in Mooresville, North Carolina
Description: [' Vision care is nice.. I love that I work at red robin and these options are available. Its much easier to get insurance through my work']

Employee: Former  Host  in Factoria, Washington State
Description: [' I was part time, so I never received any benefits. So I will be as neutral as I possibly can.']

Employee: Former  Project Manager  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [' 20 days PTO day one']

Employee: Current  host  in North Olmsted, Ohio
Description: [" You can buy health benefits through red robin. It's not the best plans, better than nothing obviously. but they aren't too expensive and they deduct from your paychecks which is cool."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [' Poor 401K match, expensive benefits, and limited vacation package structure.']

Employee: Current  Server   in Spokane, Washington State
Description: [" There are no real benefits unless you are full time for a certain amount of time. However if you have worked in the service industry then you know pretty much only the kitchen is allowed to be full time. Red Robin being corporate gets in trouble for having part time employees work full time hours so they do everything they can in order for you to not hit that 40 hour mark. But you do get a 50% discount on food when you're working and 25% when you come in with up to 4 family members."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Apple Valley, California
Description: [" Best thing is the Verizon 17% discount & meal discounts. Worst thing is the health insurance coverage and it's So expensive!"]

Employee: Current  Bussser  in Lakewood, Washington State
Description: [' There are no benefits to speak of. The employee discount is shockingly poor and the food is generally low in quality. I believe that there are benefits once you hit full time, but, due to the nature of their scheduling, you will likely never hit full time consistently.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Las Vegas, Nevada
Description: [' We do not get benefits unless you are a manager.']

Employee: Former  KM  in Novi, Michigan
Description: [' Potential to bonus $1000 every quarter -- double for GMs. 401 (k) matching, all good.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Chicago, Illinois
Description: [' United Health Care is great with simple to use Apps. Their vacation time accrues quickly.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Highlands Ranch, Colorado
Description: [' They have a pretty good benefit package, their HR department is great. Very helpful resolving problems, and the management is always eager to see people move up and succeed']

Employee: Former  Employee  in San Bruno, California
Description: [' Half off food, difficult to reach hours to maintain health coverage even as a full time employee']

Employee: Former  Server Trainer/Bartender  in Charlotte, North Carolina
Description: [" Don't get Insurance until you've been there for a year. Must work 3O hours a week which is hard to do."]

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Burlington, North Carolina
Description: [' Good benefits package with health insurance (United Health Care) with vision, dental and flexible spending option, 401k, accrued vacation time, and of course food.']

Employee: Current  line cook/prep cook/ expo  in Redmond, Washington State
Description: [" you don't get benefits until you have been there a year. I hear managers have amazing benefits. Paid time off and sick days maternatiy leave. The kitchen and dishwasher and expiditers get a free meal everyday you work. Its good food!"]

Employee: Current  Hostess  in Hershey, Pennsylvania
Description: [' They respect and give you time off as long as you request of in advance. As well as, goes through an application in which you can switch and pick up shifts. Last but not least you get a great discount on meals not just after your shift, but anytime!']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Fairfax, Virginia
Description: [' After 6 months of employment you qualify for health insurance, however you need to maintain 30 hr avg work week which management actively tries to prevent']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Overland Park, Kansas
Description: [' I got nothing. Absolutely nothing, just discounted food. was a terrible experience but that is no different from any other food serive job']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Baton Rouge, Louisiana
Description: [' there are absolutely no benefits other than available vacation time every year, which are not guaranteed and are unpaid.']

Employee: Former  Server/Waiter  in Lynnwood, Washington State
Description: [' No official benefits but the flexibility is great!']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Auburn, Washington State
Description: [' The benefits include health insurance and accrued vacation time after one year and only if you work 35+ hours a week. They have a pregnancy program available to hourly team members but full benefits are only available to salary managers including disability and up to 30 vacation days a year.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [' Health insurance was mediocre, dental plan was near useless (max benefit used within about a month and a half).']

Employee: Former  Expo  in Braintree, Massachusetts
Description: [' They have lots of discounts for working there. Like 20% off of your cell phone bill.']

Employee: Current  Assistant Manager  in Olympia, Washington State
Description: [' employee stock option, pretty standard benefits']

Employee: Former  Server  in Everett, Washington State
Description: [" There weren't any benefits that I was told about. I never heard of anyone having any health insurance or anything through them."]

Employee: Current  server  in Trussville, Alabama
Description: [' Study 1: Because of the gloomy economic situation, you have decided to monitor more carefully your spending in grocery. You have long suspected that shopping Publix is cheaper than shopping Piggly Wiggly. Now you want to test it. Study 2: In the campaign wave of “buying local,” you are worried that local grocery products may cost you more than non-locals, but your spouse argues that the opposite may be true because local products save you transportation cost. You set out a plan to test who is right.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Seattle, Washington State
Description: [' There are no benefits in my case as I was just a part time worker while being a student. Tips are a big plus on top of the good wage offered here.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Albuquerque, New Mexico
Description: [' Poor 401(k) match, decent medical/dental, high budgets for bonus.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Greenwood Village, Colorado
Description: [' Employee discount is pretty nice however the food becomes trash after a couple of weeks. Part time employees do not get benefits neither do contractors.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Allentown, Pennsylvania
Description: [" Wasn't really offered any type of bonuses for good work and they just cared about you getting done what corporate wanted to have achieved."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Seattle, Washington State
Description: [' Company stock purchase plan was a great benefit']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Robinson, Pennsylvania
Description: [" The benefits do not exist for regular employees. They say it is because you aren't full time. Even if you're working 45 hours"]

Employee: Former  Assistant General Manager  in Orange, California
Description: [' Training is very good and Standards are high. Good health benefits, at the time, 401K was good until the company changed it. vacation was standard with the industry but the good part is after some years you can increase you vacation time.']

Employee: Former  Manager  in Santa Ana, California
Description: [" It's the bottom of the barrel when it comes to coverage. You have to pay for nearly everything at every visit. It's essentially like not having insurance at all."]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Vancouver, Washington State
Description: [" there isn't one. there are no benefits, no 401k health, dental vision, unless you get to a corporate level position."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Cleveland, Ohio
Description: [' Good bonus program. Medical benefits have gotten cheap']

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Irvine, California
Description: [' Well, Red Robin does give you paid days off and i think you can take up to 48 hours worth of time off in a year. But you can only request paid time off after you have earned it, obviously. I believe you have earn up to 3 minutes of time off per hour worked. Management is always great about granting requests regarding time off, but make sure you request about 2 weeks in advance.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Sterling, Virginia
Description: [' There are no benefits for this.']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Richmond, Virginia
Description: [' Limited options for selection on benefits. Stock options are also limited and based of time in rade']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Seattle, Washington State
Description: [' I had no benefits as a part time employee. They were offered but they were really poor. The tips made up for it unless you had to miss a bunch of work do to illness or injury.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Broomfield, Colorado
Description: [' You do not get benefits unless you are full time, and they do not allow anyone to hit overtime.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Naples, Florida
Description: [' There is not a benefits package.']

Employee: Former  Line cook  in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania
Description: [' There is no benefit package it is part time work. Sorry not a career']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Victorville, California
Description: [' you get nothing but a hat and a badge.nothing.takes a whole year to get a raise if you get one.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Rancho Cucamonga, California
Description: [' They dont give you any.']

Employee: Current  Expeditor  in Denver, Colorado
Description: [' The option to donate a dollar of each paycheck to a fund that the company uses to assist down on their luck Red Robin employees is super awesome']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Carmel, Indiana
Description: [' I do not know about the benefits package as I am part time. I do know they offer full time positions for all positions.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Folsom, California
Description: [' No benefits at the server position so difficult to make this a career unless you go into management']

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Rockaway, New Jersey
Description: [' This is a standard benefits package. Nothing is better or worse, then any other restaurant company. Keep it moving']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Apple Valley, Minnesota
Description: [' The benefits are slim to none']

Employee: Current  Server  in Seattle, Washington State
Description: [' Discounts on food and drinks.']

Employee: Current  Food Server  in Scottsdale, Arizona
Description: [" There are lots of perks to working with red robin, company's give discounts for things like cell phone plans but its kind of hard to find where to apply for them."]

Employee: Current  Server   in Saint Louis, Missouri
Description: [' They took all the benefits away and remodeled all the restaurants. They knocked everyone down to minimum wage and no longer give raises ever.']

Employee: Current  Mid Manager  in Cincinnati, Ohio
Description: [' It deducts an awful lot of my income.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Towson, Maryland
Description: [' Health insurance is pretty good .']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Los Angeles, California
Description: [' Great benefits for salaried team members. Good coverage ppo. Must be full time.']

Employee: Former  Line cook/trainer  in Fort Wayne, Indiana
Description: [" Unless you are a manager don't ask for benefits. Even the managers say the benefits are horrible and not worth it."]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Lakewood, California
Description: [' Flexible schedule, 401k, Paid Leave']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Woodbridge, Virginia
Description: [" They did give me time off and was very flexible and didn't had a fit when I took the day off"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Kennewick, Washington State
Description: [' Good vacation and overall decent Healthcare coverage. Nice long term incentives.']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Foothill Ranch, California
Description: [' No benefits to speak of besides one free meal. No vacation, no sick days, no financial benefits for hourly employees.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Simi Valley, California
Description: [' you have to be a full time employee and it isnt easy to get that many hours']

Employee: Former  line cook  in Wesley Chapel, Florida
Description: [' the coast, plans are always changing and you can only apply once a year . but they also have some smaller benefits that are cool. like cell phone deals movie ticket discounts pc and laptop as well fun stuff like that']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Collegeville, Pennsylvania
Description: [" There really isn't one. They offer health care to team members who have been with the company for 6 months to a year however, it isn't a whole lot"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in Waldorf, Maryland
Description: [' cant use all your leave at one time']

Employee: Current  Hostess  in Wesley Chapel, Florida
Description: [' discounts at Fitness places, eye doctors, cell phone providers, attractions and parks']

Employee: Current  General Manager  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' BEST- car allowance (after 5 years) Worst- 401K after a year, insurance premiums increase every year']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Fresno, California
Description: [' There are no benefits as far as 401k, medical & dental. Food is discounted. Tips are based on opinion.']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in Chandler, Arizona
Description: [' You have to work at least 35 hours a week for 6 months and most employees are scheduled for 30 hours a week.']

Employee: Current  Line Cook  in South Plainfield, New Jersey
Description: [' the best part is the free hamburger you get per shift and beverage, no other benefits']

Employee: Current  Busboy  in Apex, North Carolina
Description: [' There is no benefits for part-time workers.']
